name: Kepler-318
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-318 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-318 is a star with 1.3639999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.19 times its radius. It is located 1618.19 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-318 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-318 b

Kepler-318 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.66 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-318.

The mass of Kepler-318 b is 39.62 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-318 b is 4.71 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-318 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-318 c

Kepler-318 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.82 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-318.

The mass of Kepler-318 c is 21.89 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-318 c is 3.68 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-318 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-318, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
